Name: Christopher Boardman
Summary: More Than 5 Years of experience as .NET Developer hobbyist. Expert at spotting system defects and navigating programming languages. passion for quality user support and client-side web development. Ambitious, career-focused jobseeker, anxious to obtain an Software Developer position to help launch career while achieving company goals.

WorkHistory.Name: Python Software Developer
WorkHistory.Text:
• Revised, modularized and updated old code bases to modern development standards, Improving functionality.
• Completed analysis, design, and testing phases of software development life cycle.
• Led version control efforts for a team of 6 people, employing GitHub and other public and open source repositories.
• Collaborated with project managers to select realistic coding milestones on pre-release software project development.
• Introduced agile methodologies and development best practices to division to enhance product development.

WorkHistory.Name: Cyber Security
WorkHistory.Text:
• Updated old PHP (PHP: Hypertext Pre-processor) codebases to modern development standards to help secure the LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) server.
• Used Programs Like Nmap to test for vulnerabilities and Exposures and research the best ways to secure against these types of attacks.
• Led a team of 3 people to secure a LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) server against the latest kinds of threats using CVEs (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures). 
• Collaborated with the team to select realistic targets for securing the server using the SMART (Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic, Time-based) approach.
• Kept records of all changes made to the LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) server.
